Apologies for being flippant, it was late when I posted. I was just reminded of a regular article that used to run in a paper (the Times, I think) entitled "Interesting Historical Questions to which the Answer is 'No' ". Which this, along with so many conspiracies, seems to fit.
 
 I don't deny the video is interesting; and it makes fascinating points. I also totally agree that there are elements of the WT attacks and their aftermath that no doubt run contrary to what the government has told us.
 
 But I just don't believe that such an act was a massive conspiracy, and I from what I have seen so far from this an other sources I don't see a weight of evidence to override the 'official' story. As compelling as much of what the video says, so much of it is still conjecture; claims which cannot be proven either way, backed by various quotes which are understandably confused. I feel the burden of proof is on the conspiracy theorist, and so far they have not shown anything like the amount to satisfy me they have anything but a few irregularities and confused statements.
 
 I have only watched the first half so far, will finish it when I have the chance and post further then.

Hmm. I've been thinking about the issue, and in the end the reason I feel it is not a conspiracy is not the government's lack of will to do such a thing necessarily (though I'm not saying they had/have it) but instead the fact that I just don't believe they could have.
 
 This is a government that failed to conceal that there were no WMDs in Iraq, failed to cover up their abuse of POWs and failed to cover up the fact that they had been making these so-called 'terror flights' around Europe. All of which would have been considerably easier to conceal than a cover-up on the monumental scale as the one required to plot, carry out and then falsify the 11 Sept attacks would have been. Simply, I just don't think they could have done it.

I can't tell you the amount of conversations I have had with the conspiracy nuts about 9-11. I call them nuts because to date, not one has actually shown me any evidence. I hear alot of lies that I can easily prove to be lies, but no evidence.
 
 I heard it all from this genius on another forum. He posted constantly about the cover-up, the conspiracy, blah blah blah. He listed as his sources people who had no science background and people who weren't around. Anytime anyone would point out obvious flaws in his theories, he would say that they weren't scientific enough to understand. 
 
 The interesting thing about his science, is that it wasn't science. For instance, he claimed that 757s did not hit the towers, that indeed it was remote controlled 737s. When I pointed out the fact that the pictures gave evidence that it could not have been a 737 because of the size of the hole, he ignored me. 
 He insisted that the pentagon was not hit by a plane despite eye witness accounts that say it was hit by a plane. He claimed that physics was more important than eyewitness accounts. Of course, his physics was flawed due to the fact that he lied about the material used to re-enforce the pentagon building. 
 He also claimed that there were secondary explosions at the WTC. He gave links to videos that he claimed proved this. They did not prove this, they only proved that the buildings fell because they were hit by large, fast, fuel filled airplanes. The "explosions" were in fact nothing more than debri being thrown from the very spot the planes hit the towers once they started to fall. They also fell from the top, not the bottom, destroying the lies about explosions at the bottom of the towers. 
 
 These facts do nothing to persuade the conspiracy nuts. I would explain why this is true, but someone else has done a great job of explaining this for me. I'll just link up.
 http://blogcritics.org/archives/2003/05/08/213417.php

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Was the government behind 9/11?
